content.description: In Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, an engine that delivers power <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math> is attached to a pulley that lifts a box of mass <math alttext="m sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> a vertical distance of <math alttext="y sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> at a constant speed doing work <math alttext="W sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> in time <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. In Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the same pulley delivers the same power while lifting a block of mass <math alttext="3 m sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>3</mn><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> the same distance . The pulley in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> does work <math alttext="W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, in time <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following compares <math alttext="W sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?
content.question: WorkTimeA<math alttext="W sub 2 equals W sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="t sub 2 is greater than t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>B<math alttext="W sub 2 is greater than W sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="t sub 2 equals t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>C<math alttext="W sub 2 equals W sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="t sub 2 equals t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>D<math alttext="W sub 2 is greater than W sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="t sub 2 is greater than t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
